intro: Acmadenia sheilae, commonly known as Sheil's acmadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and woodland areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
